title: 113_s1843
content: Federal Information Technology Savings, Accountability, and Transparency Act of 2013 - Modifies provisions relating to the position of Chief Information Officer (CIO)nbsp. In federal agencies to require the appointment of not more than onenbsp. CIO in the Departments of Agriculture, Commerce, Education, Energy (DOE), Health and Human Services (HHS), Interior, Justice (DOJ), Labor, State, Transportation (DOT), Treasury, and Veterans Affairs (VA), the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). Requires CIOs to: (1)nbsp, be appointed or designated by the President, in consultation withnbsp, relevant agency heads, (2)nbsp. Be chosen from among individuals who have demonstrated knowledge of information technology management practices and ability to manage such practices in large entities. And (3) be given enhanced authority in the budget planning process of an agency and the hiring of personnel who will have information technology responsibilities. Expands the responsibilities of the Chief Information Officersnbsp. Council to require the Council to: (1) develop cross-agency portfolio management practices and issue guidelines and practices for expansion of the federal enterprise architecture process, and (2) reportnbsp, to specified congressional committeesnbsp, on its activities. nbsp. Requires the Comptroller General (GAO) to examine and report on the effectiveness of the Council. Requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB)nbsp. To make available to the public the cost, schedule, and performance data for at least 80 of all information technology investments in each federal agency to which this Act applies, unless the Director or the agency CIO determines that a waiver or limitation of such disclosure requirement is in the interests of national security.
